page.title: 05Ponies,Dunchurch,Nr.Rugby
page.content: Farm Grid ref:481703 Owner:Mrs.R.E.Burton Farm name:Ox House Acreage:230 acres Land use:Grazing,wheat,oats. Welsh Mountain ponies have been on the hills of Wales since the beginning of time and are now becoming more popular in other parts of the country. Most Welsh Mountain ponies are grey, but some of them are white.Arabs brought their ponies to Wales and bred them,with their ponies,and so the colour of the Welsh Mountain pony changed its coat from dark to light. These ponies do not have to be shod because they are not ridden,but they need to have their hooves clipped. They must not be more than 12 hands high.They are fed on grass in winter. Summer grazing is limited to prevent Laminitis.
